comment: Hybrid Psych of Gender class. I was one of 5 guys in a class of 40 students. Discussions are often awkward, but maybe that's just the material. I went into it expecting moreso the psychological differences between genders, but came out feeling like I had taken a class on the history of feminism and gender roles. Show up and read the book!

Dr. Buddie is the BEST!!! Yeah experimental psych sucks, but she gives work sheet that are extremely helpful. Her study guides are also extremely helpful. I wouldn't take experimental psych with anyone else!

She's so nice and funny. She makes class really interesting, and you can tell she loves psychology. Attendence isn't mandatory, but about a third of the test is from lectures and is not in the book. She's a great teacher and I would really reccommend her!

Every day you are required to type up one page of discussion questions. At the end of the semester, you do a 20 pg+ paper on two books for the class. She's really nice, but can be a tough grader when it comes to grammar and APA formatting. Overall though, she's extremely nice and helpful.

I had her for Gender, and she taught it with a discussion format. No tests or textbooks, only a lot of articles to read and a massive paper to write about two inexpensive books! I learned SO much because she really facilitated learning through the discussions in and out of class. She makes you think critically, even if it's not easy.

She is really nice but the class is kinda boring because she just lectures. The tests are really hard if you haven't been studying along. Too much material to cram for. And she no longer puts her notes online because too many people were skipping.

She was really awesome. I'm majoring in Psyc so it was easy to me anyway but for others not majoring they told me she made it easier to understand. Tests can be a little difficult but she gives lots of extra credit.

Social Psychology was very interesting. The material was straightforward from the textbook written by David Myers. Kinda Liberal bias but not so obnoxious. Multiple choice with short essay. Do your homework for a good grade. One big paper affected my grade and big tests mean you have to be really ready for them. Must take notes.

Her class is pretty easy. She is really nice and tries to help her students by giving extra credit and things like that. She also tries to make the class fun but its not. there are a lot of notes but they are from powerpoints so its not a big deal. there is a group project which is easy. take her if you can. she may be boring but not hard!

She is a really nice teacher, but the basis of this class is notes. She tries to make it entertaining, although it usually isn't. If you need help, she is definitely willing. Just be prepared to take many notes (not her fault; it's just the course). Her notes are GREAT by the way. Quizzes, exams, a couple papers, and a project.

Really enjoyed the class, and not just b/c I am a psych major. It was very interesting. Loved the powerpoints, videos, and pictures b/c I am a visual learner.She was very down to earth. I think we had 6 assigments. They were very interesting readings and pretty easy assignment questions.I plan to take her again in another psych class.

she was awesome! her tests were pretty hard.. but nothing too bad. she was very helpful and i absolutely loved her. she does a very good job of explaining things and if you ask her a question she doesn't know, she'll find out. i didn't use my textbook one time!
He is a very interesting teacher but you won't pass the tests unless you read every chapter and you come to class because the tests are over what he says in class. Its still kinda hard though.

Dr. Buddie is hard but fair. She is always willing to help you as long as you try. She uses WEB CT all the time and therefore, check it. She gives a lot of helpful hints. She has multiple quizzes (18) during the semester, usually every Monday but they are not hard as long as you look at the material and in the long run, they help.
No Comments

Very easy going. Sweet and fun. Lectures during class are very elaborated. Very clear with everything that she says. Very helpful. Very few assignments. No busy work. No need to ever bring the text to class. No variation in classes however--power point note-taking every day. PP's are simple outlines. Go to class, write notes, study. Easy A or B.
No Comments

She gives you a study guide and the test is just like it. During class you just take notes, but psych is interesting to me so it wasn't too bad. She is really nice and will help you if you need it. I had three tests all semester and like 5 easy assignments. i recommend her.
No Comments
cool teacher, class is not easy, but do-able...i got an A...not too bad

Dr.Buddie is a wonderful teacher..she is always willing to help you,and assignments are relativly easy...And the best part is you don't really have to come to class b/c all her notes are on webct..Test are a little challenging but if you read the book and the notes you will pass w/a very good grade!!!
She was a great teacher, I even made sure I had her for the second part of methods. She works with you and makes sure that everyone understands.

I attempted to take her class over the summer. The class was supposed to be 8 weeks long and it turned out to be only 5 weeks long and you basically had to do a whole bunch of hard assignements then a paper , final, and a debate.

The class was pretty damn easy... She doesnt take attendance and she posts her notes on WebCt... You dont really even have to go. Just make sure that you study all her powerpoints before the tests as well as the optional workbook.
